intro: Potentilla pedata f. pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cinquefoil, is a variant of the species Potentilla pedata, characterized by its finely divided, pinnatifid leaves. It is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with multiple stems that are often sparsely hairy. Its flowers are yellow, occurring in clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are arranged alternately along the stems, and the plant is well adapted to rocky and well-drained soils.
